instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3330: What is 820-3330? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> powers on but no chime and fast fan spin. no beeps with ram removed. the white led just stays a solid white. Heated GPU 100C just to rule out but still same issue. No liquid damage and no previous work.

What to try next? Bios issue??

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message:
Do you get all voltages, including CPU VCORE?
Test external video and USB activity.
Bad GPU is possibly.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message: CPU VCORE steady 1.1V but does not drop

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message: same problem with new bios as well

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message:
Could still be bad GPU which can block the CPU.
Also CPU, or PCH can be the problem.
Any sign of dropped machine?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message: With GPU removed still only 1.1V on VCORE. Shouldn't you still get chime without the GPU like on 2915 boards?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message: no sign of the machine being dropped

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message:
Missing GPU can block the communication.
Did you try BIOS?
CPU could be bad, or just a simple corroded resistor....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3330</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> power on but no chime
threads.message: Same problem with new GPU, VCORE stuck at 1.1V Guess this is a no fix. Board is spotless under microscope  so I doubt a corroded resistor is the issue and not worth the time replacing PCH next.
